syllabus:
Objective:

Graduate students must become familiar with the skills of seminar preparation and presentation. These skills will help the student learn how to organize scientific data for effective public presentation.

Preparation:

All students in this section will be scheduled to present one seminar in the semester. The seminar topic will be selected by the student with the approval by the section supervisor 2 weeks before the presentation.

Presentation:

The speaker is responsible for reserving, securing, and setting up the computer/projection system to operate properly. The presentation should be 30-35 minutes in length, with 10-15 minutes left at the end for questions and discussion.

Attendance & Class Participation:

Unexcused absences will lead to a reduction of your final grade by 10 points.

Seminar Topics:

Seminar topics must meet the following criteria:

The seminar topics have to be the original research work published in the year. The seminar topic must be related to the natural product total synthesis from the following journals:

1\. Science (Multidisciplinary)  
2\. Nature (Multidisciplinary)  
3\. J. Am. Chem. Soc. (Multidisciplinary)  
4\. Angew. Chem. Int. Ed. (Multidisciplinary)  
5\. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U. S. A. (Multidisciplinary)
